intro: Eriophyllum cheiranthoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in disturbed soils, making it a pioneer species in ecological succession. Its botanical features make it an important plant for pollinators and a component of local biodiversity.
